metadata.name: Shell Invocation via Env Command - Linux
metadata.comment: Detects the use of the env command to invoke a shell. This may indicate an attempt to bypass restricted environments, escalate privileges, or execute arbitrary commands.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/env')) AND (endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/bash')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/dash')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/fish')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/sh')) OR endswith(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/zsh'))))

output.summary: Detects the use of the env command to invoke a shell. This may indicate an attempt to bypass restricted environments, escalate privileges, or execute arbitrary commands.

metadata.objective: False positive: Github operations such as ghe-backup References: https://gtfobins.github.io/gtfobins/env/#shell, https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/security/current/linux-restricted-shell-breakout-via-linux-binary-s.html
